metadata.title: RHSA-2019:2035: python-requests security update (Low)
metadata.description:
The python-requests package contains a library designed to make HTTP requests easy for developers.

Security Fix(es):

* python-requests: Redirect from HTTPS to HTTP does not remove Authorization header (CVE-2018-18074)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.7 Release Notes linked from the References section.

bugzilla.text: python-requests: Redirect from HTTPS to HTTP does not remove Authorization header

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
python-requests is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
